content: The Act may be cited as the "Y2K State and Local GAP (Government Assistance Programs) Act of 1999". Definitions are provided in the Act. The Act, known as the "Y2K State and Local GAP Act of 1999," defines various welfare programs including TANF, Medicaid, food stamps, and WIC. The Act defines various welfare programs including TANF, Medicaid, food stamps, WIC, child support enforcement, and child welfare programs. The Act defines child welfare programs, child care programs, and Y2K compliance for information technology. The Social Security Act defines Y2K compliance for information technology as accurately processing date and time data between the 20th and 21st centuries, including leap year calculations. SEC. 3. Grants to states for Y2K compliance in state and local government programs. The Secretary of Commerce awards grants to States for Y2K compliance in state and local government programs, with priority given to Federal welfare programs. A maximum of 75 grants can be awarded, with a limit of 2 grants per state. The Secretary of Commerce awards grants for Y2K compliance in state and local government programs. A maximum of 75 grants can be awarded, with a limit of 2 grants per state. The application deadline is 45 days after enactment, and states can apply through the State Governor's Office. The Secretary of Commerce awards grants for Y2K compliance in state and local government programs. Applications must include a proposed plan, budget, funding source, and specific funding amount. The Secretary of Commerce awards grants for Y2K compliance in state and local government programs. Applications must include a proposed plan, budget, funding source, and specific funding amount. A State awarded a grant must expend $1 for every $2 awarded to carry out the development and implementation of a Y2K compliance program. The Secretary of Commerce awards grants for Y2K compliance in state and local government programs. A State may receive a waiver for the matching requirement if undue hardship is proven. State expenditures can be in cash or in kind. State expenditures required for Y2K compliance grants may be in cash or in kind, including equipment or services, with no credit for pre-award expenditures. Only State expenditures made after grant award can count towards meeting the matching expenditure requirement. The State must meet the matching expenditure requirement to qualify for Y2K compliance grants. The Secretary of Commerce will assess the feasibility of proposed systems. Grants are limited to a maximum of 2 years, and funds awarded to a State remain available without a fiscal year limitation. Funds awarded under this section to a State shall remain available without fiscal year limitation. States must submit annual reports on compliance program results, and a final report within 90 days of grant termination. The Secretary of Commerce must submit a final report to Congress evaluating programs funded under grants within 90 days of grant termination. $40,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 1999 to 2001 from Y2K Emergency Supplemental Funds.
